About the Default Revision

When you check out or get a revision, the default revision is checked out unless you specify a different revision. By default, the default revision is the latest revision (also known as the tip) of a versioned file. However, you can define the default revision to be a version label.

Defining the Default Revision in Project Workspace Settings

The default revision is stored in the Default Version field of your project or project database's workspace settings (File | Properties | Workspace Settings tab). The default revision can be specified in the project configuration options by your Administrator or Project Leader. When a default revision is specified for your project database, all of the projects within the project database inherit the default revision setting. For more information, see workspace hierarchies. You can define a default revision for a project or project database. When you define a default revision, Serena ChangeMan Version Manager automatically checks out or gets the revision associated with the specified default revision.

Using Default Revisions to Automate Branching

Defining a default revision is required when your project database is set up for automatic branching and merging. For information on branching, see the "Branching and Merging Revisions" chapter in the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager Administrator's Guide.
